info.title: sevDesk Receipt API
info.description:
# General information Welcome to our Receipt API!
You can use it to manage receipts (vouchers) in your sevDesk account. # Cross-Origin Resource Sharing This API features Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).
It enables cross-domain communication from the browser.
All responses have a wildcard same-origin which makes them completely public and accessible to everyone, including any code on any site. # Embedding resources When retrieving resources by using this API, you might encounter nested resources in the resources you requested.
For example, an invoice always contains a contact, of which you can see the ID and the object name.
This API gives you the possibility to embed these resources completely into the resources you originally requested.
Taking our invoice example, this would mean, that you would not only see the ID and object name of a contact, but rather the complete contact resource. To embed resources, all you need to do is to add the query parameter 'embed' to your GET request.
As values, you can provide the name of the nested resource.
Multiple nested resources are also possible by providing multiple names, separated by a comma.

servers.description: Our main application instance which most of our customers work with
Our swiss application instance, hosted and maintained by smart seven AG

post.description: Creates a voucher together with positions and discounts.

requestBody.description:
Creation data. Please be aware, that you need to provide at least all required parameter
    of the voucher and voucher position model!

sevClient.description: Client to which voucher belongs. Will be filled automatically

createUser.description: User who created the voucher. Will be filled automatically.

voucherDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

supplier.description:
The contact used in the voucher as a supplier.
If you don't have a contact as a supplier, you can set this object to null.

supplierName.description:
The supplier name.
The value you provide here will determine what supplier name is shown for the voucher in case you did not provide a supplier.

description.description: The description of the voucher. Essentially the voucher number.

documentPreview.description: The document preview of the voucher.

payDate.description: Needs to be timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

status.description: Please have a look in our API-Overview to see what the different status codes mean

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumNet

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumTax

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumGross

sumDiscounts.description: Sum of all discounts in the voucher

sumDiscountsForeignCurrency.description: Discounts sum of the voucher in the foreign currency

showNet.description: If true, the net amount of each position will be regarded. Otherwise gross amount

paidAmount.description: Amount which has already been paid for this voucher by the customer

taxType.description:
Tax type of the voucher.
There are four tax types:
1. default - Umsatzsteuer ausweisen
2. eu - Steuerfreie innergemeinschaftliche Lieferung (Europäische Union)
3. noteu - Steuerschuldnerschaft des Leistungsempfängers (außerhalb EU, z. B. Schweiz)
4. custom - Using custom tax set
Tax rates are heavily connected to the tax type used.

creditDebit.description: Defines if your voucher is a credit (C) or debit (D)

hidden.description: Defines if your voucher is hidden

id.description: Unique identifier of the cost centre

voucherType.description: Type of the voucher. For more information on the different types, check this section of our API-Overview

recurringIntervall.description:
The interval in months in which recurring vouchers are generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringStartDate.description:
The date when the recurring vouchers start being generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringNextVoucher.description:
The date when the next voucher should be generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringLastVoucher.description: The date when the last voucher was generated.

recurringEndDate.description:
The date when the recurring vouchers end being generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

enshrined.description: Defines if and when voucher was enshrined. Enshrined vouchers can not be manipulated.

taxSet.description: Tax set of the voucher. Needs to be added if you chose the tax type custom

deliveryDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

deliveryDateUntil.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

update.description: Date of last voucher position update

sevClient.description: Client to which voucher position belongs. Will be filled automatically

voucher.description: The voucher to which the position belongs.

accountingType.description:
The accounting type to which the position belongs.
An accounting type is the booking account to which the position belongs.
For more information, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

id.description: Unique identifier of the accounting type

estimatedAccountingType.description:
The accounting type to which the position belongs estimated by our voucher recognition.
An accounting type is the booking account to which the position belongs.
For more information, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

id.description: Unique identifier of the accounting type

taxRate.description: Tax rate of the voucher position.

sum.description:
Sum of the voucher position.
Is only regarded if 'sumNet' and 'sumGross' are not given.
Whether net or gross is then determined by 'net' attribute.

net.description:
Determines whether 'sumNet' or 'sumGross' is regarded.
If both are not given, 'sum' is regarded and treated as net or gross depending on 'net'.

isAsset.description: Determines whether position is regarded as an asset which can be depreciated.

sumNet.description:
Net sum of the voucher position.
Only regarded if 'net' is 'true', otherwise its readOnly.

sumTax.description: Tax sum of the voucher position.

sumGross.description:
Gross sum of the voucher position.
Only regarded if 'net' is 'false', otherwise its readOnly.

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum. Is equal to sumNet.

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum. Is equal to sumTax.

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum. Is equal to sumGross.

voucherPosDelete.description: The voucher positions you want to delete. If you don't have any, set to null.

filename.description: Filename of a previously upload file which should be attached.

sevClient.description: Client to which voucher belongs. Will be filled automatically

createUser.description: User who created the voucher. Will be filled automatically.

voucherDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

The contact used in the voucher as a supplier.
If you don't have a contact as a supplier, you can set this object to null.

The value you provide here will determine what supplier name is shown for the voucher in case you did not provide a supplier.

description.description: The description of the voucher. Essentially the voucher number.

documentPreview.description: The document preview of the voucher.

payDate.description: Needs to be timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

post.description:
Upload a file which can be attached to a voucher afterwards.
The filename you receive in the response of this request, can be used in the request which creates a voucher.
For a detailed explanation of how to attach a file to a voucher, visit this section of our API-Overview.

get.description: There are a multitude of parameter which can be used to filter. A few of them are attached but for a complete list please check out this list

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of the vouchers to retrieve.

parameters.name: creditDebit
parameters.description: Define if you only want credit or debit vouchers.

parameters.name: descriptionLike
parameters.description: Retrieve all vouchers with a description like this.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all vouchers with a date equal or higher

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Retrieve all vouchers with a date equal or lower

parameters.name: contact[id]
parameters.description: Retrieve all vouchers with this contact. Must be provided with contact[objectName]

parameters.name: contact[objectName]
parameters.description: Only required if contact[id] was provided. 'Contact' should be used as value.

post.description:
You can still create vouchers by using this request, however, this endpoint does not allow the simultaneous creation of voucher positions. It only creates the voucher object!
Please use the 'saveVoucher' endpoint for creating vouchers together with positions, discounts, etc., in one request.
Support for users integrating with this endpoint may be limited.

Tax rates are heavily connected to the tax type used.

creditDebit.description: Defines if your voucher is a credit (C) or debit (D)

hidden.description: Defines if your voucher is hidden

id.description: Unique identifier of the cost centre

voucherType.description: Type of the voucher. For more information on the different types, check this section of our API-Overview

recurringIntervall.description:
The interval in months in which recurring vouchers are generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringStartDate.description:
The date when the recurring vouchers start being generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringNextVoucher.description:
The date when the next voucher should be generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

recurringLastVoucher.description: The date when the last voucher was generated.

recurringEndDate.description:
The date when the recurring vouchers end being generated.
Necessary attribute for all recurring vouchers.

enshrined.description: Defines if and when voucher was enshrined. Enshrined vouchers can not be manipulated.

taxSet.description: Tax set of the voucher. Needs to be added if you chose the tax type custom

deliveryDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

deliveryDateUntil.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

put.description:
This endpoint can be used to book vouchers.
Vouchers are booked on payment accounts where (bank) transactions are located and might be linked to the transactions by using this endpoint.
For more detailed information about booking vouchers, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.
Be aware, that this endpoint is deprecated and the new endpoint 'bookAmount' should be used instead.

ammount.description: Amount which should be booked. Can also be a partial amount.

date.description: The booking date. Most likely the current date.

type.description:
Define a type for the booking.
The following type abbreviations are available (abbreviation <-> meaning).
  • N <-> Normal booking / partial booking
  • CB <-> Reduced amount due to discount (skonto)
  • CF <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to currency fluctuations
  • O <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to other reasons
  • OF <-> Higher amount due to reminder charges
  • MTC <-> Reduced amount due to the monetary traffic costs

checkAccount.description: The check account on which should be booked.

id.description: The id of the check account on which should be booked.

checkAccountTransaction.description:
The check account transaction on which should be booked.
The transaction will be linked to the voucher.

id.description: The id of the check account transaction on which should be booked.

createFeed.description: Determines if a feed is created for the booking process.

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed voucher log entry

objects.description: TODO: Document VoucherLog and enter scheme here

put.description:
This endpoint can be used to book vouchers.
Vouchers are booked on payment accounts where (bank) transactions are located and might be linked to the transactions by using this endpoint.
For more detailed information about booking vouchers, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

amount.description: Amount which should be booked. Can also be a partial amount.

date.description: The booking date. Most likely the current date.

type.description:
Define a type for the booking.
The following type abbreviations are available (abbreviation <-> meaning).
  • N <-> Normal booking / partial booking
  • CB <-> Reduced amount due to discount (skonto)
  • CF <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to currency fluctuations
  • O <-> Reduced/Higher amount due to other reasons
  • OF <-> Higher amount due to reminder charges
  • MTC <-> Reduced amount due to the monetary traffic costs

checkAccount.description: The check account on which should be booked.

id.description: The id of the check account on which should be booked.

checkAccountTransaction.description:
The check account transaction on which should be booked.
The transaction will be linked to the voucher.

id.description: The id of the check account transaction on which should be booked.

createFeed.description: Determines if a feed is created for the booking process.

200.description: Successful operation - Returns changed voucher log entry

objects.description: TODO: Document VoucherLog and enter scheme here

get.description: Retrieve all voucher positions depending on the filters defined in the query.

parameters.name: voucher[id]
parameters.description: Retrieve all vouchers positions belonging to this voucher. Must be provided with voucher[objectName]

parameters.name: voucher[objectName]
parameters.description: Only required if voucher[id] was provided. 'Voucher' should be used as value.

update.description: Date of last voucher position update

sevClient.description: Client to which voucher position belongs. Will be filled automatically

voucher.description: The voucher to which the position belongs.

accountingType.description:
The accounting type to which the position belongs.
An accounting type is the booking account to which the position belongs.
For more information, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

id.description: Unique identifier of the accounting type

estimatedAccountingType.description:
The accounting type to which the position belongs estimated by our voucher recognition.
An accounting type is the booking account to which the position belongs.
For more information, please refer to this section of our API-Overview.

id.description: Unique identifier of the accounting type

taxRate.description: Tax rate of the voucher position.

sum.description:
Sum of the voucher position.
Is only regarded if 'sumNet' and 'sumGross' are not given.
Whether net or gross is then determined by 'net' attribute.

net.description:
Determines whether 'sumNet' or 'sumGross' is regarded.
If both are not given, 'sum' is regarded and treated as net or gross depending on 'net'.

isAsset.description: Determines whether position is regarded as an asset which can be depreciated.

sumNet.description:
Net sum of the voucher position.
Only regarded if 'net' is 'true', otherwise its readOnly.

sumTax.description: Tax sum of the voucher position.

sumGross.description:
Gross sum of the voucher position.
Only regarded if 'net' is 'false', otherwise its readOnly.

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum. Is equal to sumNet.

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum. Is equal to sumTax.

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum. Is equal to sumGross.

sevClient.description: Client to which voucher belongs. Will be filled automatically

createUser.description: User who created the voucher. Will be filled automatically.

voucherDate.description: Needs to be provided as timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

supplier.description:
The contact used in the voucher as a supplier.
If you don't have a contact as a supplier, you can set this object to null.

supplierName.description:
The supplier name.
The value you provide here will determine what supplier name is shown for the voucher in case you did not provide a supplier.

description.description: The description of the voucher. Essentially the voucher number.

documentPreview.description: The document preview of the voucher.

payDate.description: Needs to be timestamp or dd.mm.yyyy

status.description: Please have a look in our API-Overview to see what the different status codes mean

sumNetAccounting.description: Net accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumNet

sumTaxAccounting.description: Tax accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumTax

sumGrossAccounting.description: Gross accounting sum of the voucher. Is usually the same as sumGross

sumDiscounts.description: Sum of all discounts in the voucher

sumDiscountsForeignCurrency.description: Discounts sum of the voucher in the foreign currency

showNet.description: If true, the net amount of each position will be regarded. Otherwise gross amount

paidAmount.description: Amount which has already been paid for this voucher by the customer

taxType.description:
Tax type of the voucher.
There are four tax types:
1. default - Umsatzsteuer ausweisen
2. eu - Steuerfreie innergemeinschaftliche Lieferung (Europäische Union)
3. noteu - Steuerschuldnerschaft des Leistungsempfängers (außerhalb EU, z. B. Schweiz)
4. custom - Using custom tax set
Tax rates are heavily connected to the tax type used.
